definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?
sentences.chinese: 人豈能將銅與鐵，就是北方的鐵折斷呢。

sentences.english: He’d fractured his rib and hip.
sentences.chinese: 他折斷了胸骨和髖關節。

sentences.english: He broke off the twig with a snap.
sentences.chinese: 他啪地一聲把那根樹枝折斷了。

sentences.english: Though the flower dies if plucked.
Bow and sword and battle I will abolish from the land, so that all may lie down in safety.
sentences.chinese: 又必在國中折斷弓刀，止息爭戰，使他們安然躺臥。

sentences.english: This is when a bone is bent and breaks along only 1 side, like a young stick of wood.
sentences.chinese: 當骨頭彎曲，且就一側邊折斷，如同一根青嫩的枝條。

sentences.english: He called the waiter with a snap of his fingers.
sentences.chinese: 一根樹枝突然折斷打破了寂靜。

sentences.english: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
sentences.chinese: 又保全他一身的骨頭，連一根也不折斷。

sentences.english: It sounded like someone just snapped a twig right behind me.
sentences.chinese: 好象是有人在我背後折斷了一根小樹枝。

sentences.english: The course was a snap for him.
sentences.chinese: 一根樹枝突然折斷打破了寂靜。

sentences.english: Tommpson & Dummer stated that the incidence of NiTi instrument separation was related to instrument design and mechanical properties.
sentences.chinese: 器械的折斷與器械的設計和機械性能密切相關。

sentences.english: A single fracture is when a bone is broken in just 1 place.
sentences.chinese: 單處骨折指的是骨頭在僅一處被折斷。

sentences.english: The tide washed in some broken spars.
sentences.chinese: 潮水衝來幾根折斷的桅杆。

sentences.english: There They were hearing trees snap.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽到樹木被攔腰折斷。

sentences.english: The branch cracked under the weight of the snow.
sentences.chinese: 樹枝在雪的重壓下啪地一聲折斷了。

sentences.english: You snap out the kit's green plastic pieces from a frame, just like you would for a model airplane.
sentences.chinese: 你折斷了套綠色塑膠片從幀，就像你會爲飛機模型。

definition: to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
to be unable to move a single step
to break/to sever/to turn off (electric switch)
deformation/to become deformed/to change shape/to morph
